title: Think. Over the week
summary: In our Editorial section last week, the most important topic analysed was S&P’s upgrade of India’s sovereign ratings to ‘BBB’ after 18 years. Though the Editorial welcomes the decision, calling it long overdue, it argues that given India’s fiscal rectitude and strong...
fullContent: In our Editorial section last week, the most important topic analysed was S&P’s upgrade of India’s sovereign ratings to ‘BBB’ after 18 years. Though the Editorial welcomes the decision, calling it long overdue, it argues that given India’s fiscal rectitude and strong institutions it deserves an even higher sovereign rating. The current geopolitical scenario and India’s strategic shift was the other key issue commented upon in our Editorial section. Our Editorial welcomed India’s tilt towards the BRICS partners in the backdrop of US’ punitive tariffs on India and the resultant souring of ties. Another Editorial commented on ICICI Bank’s significant hike in minimum balance limits for new customers and its subsequent climbdown. It was argued that the fuss over the minimum balance hike was overdone and what warrants scrutiny is the charges banks levy on various services offered including printing of accounts statements, locker fees, fees on cash deposits and withdrawals.

title: Top Brokers See Shrinking Client Bases, Dhan Inches Past Motilal Oswal

title: Gold heads for weekly loss, spotlight on Trump-Putin talks
summary: Gold prices remained stable on Friday but are set for a weekly decline due to strong inflation data reducing expectations for rate cuts. Market attention is now on the meeting between U.S. President Trump and Russia's Putin. Spot gold was nearly unchanged at $3,336.
fullContent: Gold prices remained stable on Friday but are set for a weekly decline due to strong inflation data reducing expectations for rate cuts. Market attention is now on the meeting between U.S. President Trump and Russia's Putin. Spot gold was nearly unchanged at $3,336.66 per ounce, down 1.8% for the week.

summary: Both nations can drive a new era of industrial competitiveness that is not just bilateral, but global in its impact.

title: Wall Street Week Ahead: US stocks train sights on Jackson Hole Fed gathering
summary: Investors are keenly waiting for the Jackson Hole symposium. Federal Reserve policymakers will gather to discuss interest rate cuts. These cuts could potentially boost stock prices. Jerome Powell's speech on Friday will be crucial. Market anticipates further rate cuts this year.
fullContent: Investors are keenly waiting for the Jackson Hole symposium. Federal Reserve policymakers will gather to discuss interest rate cuts. These cuts could potentially boost stock prices. Jerome Powell's speech on Friday will be crucial. Market anticipates further rate cuts this year. Sectors like homebuilders and industrials may benefit. Powell needs to balance economic outlook to avoid market disruption.

title: World equities flat, crude oil prices fall as Trump, Putin hold high-stakes talks
summary: Global stock markets remained stable near record highs on Friday. Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin met in Alaska to discuss Ukraine. US Treasury bond prices declined amid expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut. The Dow reached a new intraday high.
fullContent: Global stock markets remained stable near record highs on Friday. Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin met in Alaska to discuss Ukraine. US Treasury bond prices declined amid expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut. The Dow reached a new intraday high. European shares saw a slight pullback after nearing a five-month high.

title: Corporate earnings slow to multi-quarter lows in Q1 as banking, consumer durables weigh
summary: Indian companies experienced a slowdown in revenue and profit growth during the June quarter, hitting multi-quarter lows due to weak performance in banking, consumer durables, and capital goods sectors.
fullContent: Indian companies experienced a slowdown in revenue and profit growth during the June quarter, hitting multi-quarter lows due to weak performance in banking, consumer durables, and capital goods sectors. While some sectors like cement and hospitality showed double-digit profit growth, overall operating margins contracted.

title: European shares log second weekly gain, focus on Trump-Putin talks
summary: European shares experienced a slight dip, influenced by declines in tech and financial sectors, even as investors eyed the U.S.-Russia summit. While miners and healthcare showed gains, corporate earnings painted a mixed picture.
fullContent: European shares experienced a slight dip, influenced by declines in tech and financial sectors, even as investors eyed the U.S.-Russia summit. While miners and healthcare showed gains, corporate earnings painted a mixed picture. Pandora's significant fall due to weakening sales and Standard Chartered's probe call impacted market sentiment.

title: Trump says no imminent plans to penalise China for buying Russian oil, while India stares at looming 50% tariff
summary: Following a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, U.S. President Donald Trump stated he doesn't foresee the immediate need for retaliatory tariffs on countries purchasing Russian oil.
fullContent: Following a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, U.S. President Donald Trump stated he doesn't foresee the immediate need for retaliatory tariffs on countries purchasing Russian oil. However, Trump indicated this situation might change, suggesting he may need to consider such tariffs in the coming weeks, depending on future developments.

title: Dow ends higher after UnitedHealth gains, other indexes slip on rate cut uncertainty
summary: The Dow Jones closed higher, hitting a record high, propelled by UnitedHealth's surge after Berkshire Hathaway increased its stake. Other indexes slipped amid mixed economic data impacting Federal Reserve's policy decisions.
fullContent: The Dow Jones closed higher, hitting a record high, propelled by UnitedHealth's surge after Berkshire Hathaway increased its stake. Other indexes slipped amid mixed economic data impacting Federal Reserve's policy decisions. Investors are anticipating a potential rate cut in September. Trump and Putin's meeting in Alaska raised hopes for resolving the Ukraine conflict and influencing crude prices.

title: Tata, Merck explore exclusive chemical deal for Dholera semiconductor facility
summary: Semiconductor manufacturing uses more than 150 chemicals and over 30 gases and minerals in the production processes. Analysts said this exclusive partnership would provide Tata Electronics with supply chain stability, a critical factor in the volatile global semiconductor...
fullContent: Semiconductor manufacturing uses more than 150 chemicals and over 30 gases and minerals in the production processes. Analysts said this exclusive partnership would provide Tata Electronics with supply chain stability, a critical factor in the volatile global semiconductor market and will help Merck make a foray into India's burgeoning semiconductor industry.

title: No deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine after Trump rolls out red carpet for Putin
summary: ​"There's no deal until there's a deal," the U.S. president said, after Putin claimed they had hammered out an "understanding" on Ukraine and warned Europe not to "torpedo the nascent progress." Trump said he would call Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European...
fullContent: ​"There's no deal until there's a deal," the U.S. president said, after Putin claimed they had hammered out an "understanding" on Ukraine and warned Europe not to "torpedo the nascent progress." Trump said he would call Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders to brief them on the talks.

title: Revaluation gains lift India’s forex kitty to $693.6 billion
summary: India's foreign exchange reserves increased by $4.7 billion, reaching $693.6 billion in the week ending August 8, according to RBI data. This rise was primarily driven by revaluation gains from a weaker dollar and higher gold prices, partially offset by the RBI's market...
fullContent: India's foreign exchange reserves increased by $4.7 billion, reaching $693.6 billion in the week ending August 8, according to RBI data. This rise was primarily driven by revaluation gains from a weaker dollar and higher gold prices, partially offset by the RBI's market intervention, including $5 billion in FX swaps.
